alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Laurens; Washington (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Laurens, southeastern Washington and Johnson Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 703 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Wrightsville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Wrightsville, Harrison, Kite, Lovett, Spann, Donovan, New Home, Tuckers Crossroad, Brewton and Pringle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
